qas.question: What is the official language of Eritrea?

answers.text: The nation has no official language

qas.question: What does the Constitution establish of all Eritrean languages?
What was the most widely spoken language in Eritrea in 2006?
What languages serve as de facto working languages in Eritrea?
What language is used in Eritrean university education and many technical fields?
What is the second most spoken language in Eritrea?
How many people speak English in Eritrea?
How many speakers of Tigrinya are there in the world?
How many people speak Italian in Eritrea?
What language is used for business in Eritrea?

context: Eritrea is a multilingual country. <a0_0>The nation has no official language<a0_0/>, as the Constitution establishes the "<a1_0>equality<a1_0/> of all Eritrean languages". However, <a2_0>Tigrinya<a2_0/> serves as the de facto language of national identity. With <b6_0><b8_0>2,540,000<b8_0/><b6_0/> total speakers of a population of <b7_0>5,254,000<b7_0/> in 2006, Tigrinya is the most widely spoken language, particularly in the southern and central parts of Eritrea. <a3_0><b9_0>Modern Standard Arabic<b9_0/> and <a4_0><b5_0>English<b5_0/><a4_0/><a3_0/> serve as de facto working languages, with the latter used in university education and many technical fields. Italian, the former colonial language, is widely used in commerce and is taught as a second language in schools, with a few elderly monolinguals.
